12.name: guillotine
12.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.
18.short_effect: Immediately ends wild battles.  Forces trainers to switch Pokémon.

19.name: fly
19.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
19.short_effect: User flies high into the air, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.

20.name: bind
20.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.
20.short_effect: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.

119.name: mirror-move
119.description:
Uses the last move targeted at the user by a Pokémon still on the field.  A move counts as targeting the user even if it hit multiple Pokémon, as long as the user was one of them; however, moves targeting the field itself do not count.  If the user has not been targeted by an appropriate move since entering the field, or if no Pokémon that targeted the user remains on the field, this move will fail.

Moves that failed, missed, had no effect, or were blocked are still copied.

Assist moves, time-delayed moves, “meta” moves that operate on other moves/Pokémon/abilities, and some other special moves cannot be copied and are ignored; if the last move to hit the user was such a move, the previous move will be used instead.  The full list of ignored moves is: acid armor, acupressure, after you, agility, ally switch, amnesia, aqua ring, aromatherapy, aromatic mist, assist, autotomize, barrier, baton pass, belch, belly drum, bide, bulk up, calm mind, camouflage, celebrate, charge, coil, conversion, conversion 2, copycat, cosmic power, cotton guard, counter, crafty shield, curse, defend order, defense curl, destiny bond, detect, doom desire, double team, dragon dance, electric terrain, endure, final gambit, flower shield, focus energy, focus punch, follow me, future sight, geomancy, grassy terrain, gravity, growth, grudge, guard split, hail, happy hour, harden, haze, heal bell, heal order, heal pulse, healing wish, helping hand, hold hands, hone claws, howl, imprison, ingrain, ion deluge, iron defense, kings shield, light screen, lucky chant, lunar dance, magic coat, magnet rise, magnetic flux, mat block, me first, meditate, metronome, milk drink, mimic, minimize, mirror coat, mirror move, mist, misty terrain, moonlight, morning sun, mud sport, nasty plot, nature power, perish song, power split, power trick, protect, psych up, quick guard, quiver dance, rage powder, rain dance, recover, recycle, reflect, reflect type, refresh, rest, rock polish, role play, roost, rototiller, safeguard, sandstorm, shadow blast, shadow bolt, shadow half, shadow rush, shadow shed, shadow sky, shadow storm, shadow wave, sharpen, shell smash, shift gear, sketch, slack off, sleep talk, snatch, soft boiled, spikes, spiky shield, spit up, splash, stealth rock, sticky web, stockpile, struggle, substitute, sunny day, swallow, swords dance, synthesis, tail glow, tailwind, teleport, toxic spikes, transform, water sport, wide guard, wish, withdraw and work up.

This move cannot be selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk, nor forced by encore.

164.name: substitute
164.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
164.short_effect: Transfers 1/4 of the user's max HP into a doll, protecting the user from further damage or status changes until it breaks.
164.flavor_text:

1/4 user's max HP.

165.name: struggle

This move is used automatically when a Pokémon cannot use any other move legally, e.g., due to having no PP remaining or being under the effect of both encore and torment at the same time.

This move's recoil is not treated as recoil for the purposes of anything that affects recoil, such as the ability rock head.  It also is not prevented by magic guard.

This move cannot be copied by mimic, mirror move, or sketch, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

An icy attack that
lowers SPEED.

197.name: detect
197.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
197.short_effect: Prevents any moves from hitting the user this turn.
197.flavor_text:
Evades attack that
turn. It may fail.

198.name: bone-rush
198.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

199.name: lock-on
199.description:
If the user targets the same target again before the end of the next turn, the move it uses is guaranteed to hit.  This move itself also ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
199.short_effect: Ensures that the user's next move will hit the target.
199.flavor_text:
Ensures the next
attack will hit.

200.name: outrage
200.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.
200.short_effect: Hits every turn for 2-3 turns, then confuses the user.

201.name: sandstorm
201.description:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.
201.short_effect: Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.

202.name: giga-drain
202.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
202.short_effect: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

203.name: endure
203.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
203.short_effect: Prevents the user's HP from lowering below 1 this turn.

204.name: charm
204.description: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.
204.short_effect: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

205.name: rollout
205.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.
205.short_effect: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, resetting after five turns.

206.name: false-swipe
206.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Will not reduce the target's HP below 1.
206.short_effect: Cannot lower the target's HP below 1.
206.flavor_text:
Leaves the foe
with at least 1HP.

207.name: swagger
207.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.
207.short_effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages and confuses the target.

208.name: milk-drink
208.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.
208.short_effect: Heals the user by half its max HP.
208.flavor_text:
Restores HP by 1/2
the max HP.

209.name: spark
209.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
209.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
209.flavor_text:
An attack that may
cause paralysis.

210.name: fury-cutter
210.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power doubles after every time this move is used, whether consecutively or not, maxing out at 16x.  If this move misses or the user leaves the field, power resets.
210.short_effect: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, maxing out after five turns.

211.name: steel-wing
211.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.
211.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by one stage.

212.name: mean-look
212.description:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.
212.short_effect: Prevents the target from leaving battle.

213.name: attract
213.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.
213.short_effect: Target falls in love if it has the opposite gender, and has a 50% chance to refuse attacking the user.

214.name: sleep-talk
214.description:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
214.short_effect: Randomly uses one of the user's other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.

215.name: heal-bell
215.description: Removes major status effects and confusion from every Pokémon in the user's party.
215.short_effect: Cures the entire party of major status effects.

216.name: return
216.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.
216.short_effect: Power increases with happiness, up to a maximum of 102.
216.flavor_text:
An attack that is
based on loyalty.

217.name: present
217.description:
Randomly uses one of the following effects.

Effect                                             | Chance
-------------------------------------------------- | -----:
Inflicts regular damage with 40 power  |    40%
Inflicts regular damage with 80 power  |    30%
Inflicts regular damage with 120 power |    10%
Heals the target for 1/4 its max HP    |    20%

On average, this move inflicts regular damage with 52 power and heals the target for 1/20 its max HP.
217.short_effect: Randomly inflicts damage with power from 40 to 120 or heals the target for 1/4 its max HP.
217.flavor_text:
A bomb that may
restore HP.

218.name: frustration
218.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.
218.short_effect: Power increases as happiness decreases, up to a maximum of 102.
218.flavor_text:
An attack based on
lack of loyalty.

219.name: safeguard
219.description:
Protects Pokémon on the user's side of the field from major status effects and confusion for five turns.  Does not cancel existing ailments.  This effect remains even if the user leaves the field.

If yawn is used while this move is in effect, it will immediately fail.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.

This effect does not prevent the confusion caused by outrage, petal dance, or thrash.
219.short_effect: Protects the user's field from major status ailments and confusion for five turns.

220.name: pain-split
220.description:
Changes the user's and target's remaining HP to the average of their current remaining HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect does not count as inflicting damage for other moves and effects that respond to damage taken.

This effect fails against a substitute.
220.short_effect: Sets the user's and targets's HP to the average of their current HP.
220.flavor_text:
Adds user & foe's
HPs. Shares total.

221.name: sacred-fire
221.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.
221.short_effect: Has a 50% chance to burn the target.  Lets frozen Pokémon thaw themselves.
221.flavor_text:
An attack that may
inflict a burn.

222.name: magnitude
222.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is selected at random between 10 and 150, with an average of 71:

Magnitude | Power | Chance
--------: | ----: | -----:
        4 |    10 |     5%
        5 |    30 |    10%
        6 |    50 |    20%
        7 |    70 |    30%
        8 |    90 |    20%
        9 |   110 |    10%
       10 |   150 |     5%

This move has double power against Pokémon currently underground due to dig.
222.flavor_text:
A ground attack
with random power.

223.name: dynamic-punch
223.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.
223.short_effect: Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.

224.name: megahorn
224.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

225.name: dragon-breath
225.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
225.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

226.name: baton-pass
226.description:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.
226.short_effect: Allows the trainer to switch out the user and pass effects along to its replacement.

227.name: encore
227.description:
The next 4–8 times (selected at random) the target attempts to move, it is forced to repeat its last used move.  If the selected move allows the trainer to select a target, an opponent will be selected at random each turn.  If the target is prevented from using the selected move by some other effect, struggle will be used instead.  This effect ends if the selected move runs out of PP.

If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, if it does not know the selected move, or if the selected move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.  If the target's last used move was encore, mimic, mirror move, sketch, struggle, or transform, this move will fail.
227.short_effect: Forces the target to repeat its last used move every turn for 2 to 6 turns.
227.flavor_text:
Makes the foe re­
peat 2-6 times.

228.name: pursuit
228.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow me.
228.short_effect: Has double power against, and can hit, Pokémon attempting to switch out.

229.name: rapid-spin
229.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Removes leech seed from the user, frees the user from bind, clamp, fire spin, magma storm, sand tomb, whirlpool, and wrap, and clears spikes, stealth rock, and toxic spikes from the user's side of the field.  If this move misses or has no effect, its effect doesn't activate.
229.short_effect: Frees the user from binding moves, removes Leech Seed, and blows away Spikes.

230.name: sweet-scent
230.description: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.
230.short_effect: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.

231.name: iron-tail
231.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
231.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
231.flavor_text:
An attack that may
reduce DEFENSE.

232.name: metal-claw
232.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Attack one stage.
232.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Attack by one stage.
232.flavor_text:
An attack that may
up user's ATTACK.

233.name: vital-throw
233.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

234.name: morning-sun
234.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
234.short_effect: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.

235.name: synthesis
235.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
235.short_effect: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.

236.name: moonlight
236.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
236.short_effect: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.

237.name: hidden-power
237.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.
237.short_effect: Power and type depend upon user's IVs.  Power can range from 30 to 70.
237.flavor_text:
The power varies
with the POKéMON.

238.name: cross-chop
238.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
238.short_effect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
238.flavor_text:
Has a high criti­
cal hit ratio.

239.name: twister
239.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, this move will hit with double power.
239.short_effect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
239.flavor_text:
Whips up a tornado
to attack.

240.name: rain-dance
240.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.
240.short_effect: Changes the weather to rain for five turns.
240.flavor_text:
Boosts the power of WATER-
type moves for 5 turns.

241.name: sunny-day
241.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.
241.short_effect: Changes the weather to sunny for five turns.

242.name: crunch
242.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
242.short_effect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
242.flavor_text:
An attack that may
lower SPCL.DEF.

243.name: mirror-coat
243.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
243.short_effect: Inflicts twice the damage the user received from the last special hit it took.
243.flavor_text:
Counters a SPCL.
ATK. move double.

244.name: psych-up
244.description:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
244.short_effect: Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

245.name: extreme-speed
245.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

246.name: ancient-power
246.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.
246.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats by one stage.
246.flavor_text:
An attack that may
raise all stats.

247.name: shadow-ball
247.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
247.short_effect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
247.flavor_text:
An attack that may
lower SPCL.DEF.

248.name: future-sight
248.description:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
248.short_effect: Hits the target two turns later.
248.flavor_text:
An attack that
hits on 3rd turn.

249.name: rock-smash
249.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
249.short_effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
249.flavor_text:
An attack that may
lower DEFENSE.

250.name: whirlpool
250.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.
250.short_effect: Prevents the target from leaving battle and inflicts 1/16 its max HP in damage for 2-5 turns.

251.name: beat-up
251.description:
Inflicts typeless regular damage.  Every Pokémon in the user's party, excepting those that have fainted or have a major status effect, attacks the target.  Calculated stats are ignored; the base stats for the target and assorted attackers are used instead.  The random factor in the damage formula is not used.  dark Pokémon still get STAB.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.
251.short_effect: Hits once for every conscious Pokémon the trainer has.
251.flavor_text:
Party POKéMON join
in the attack.

252.name: fake-out
252.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Causes the target to flinch.  Can only be used on the user's first turn after entering the field.
252.short_effect: Can only be used as the first move after the user enters battle.  Causes the target to flinch.

253.name: uproar
253.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
253.short_effect: Forced to use this move for several turns.  Pokémon cannot fall asleep in that time.
253.flavor_text:
Causes an uproar for 2 to 5
turns and prevents sleep.

254.name: stockpile
254.description:
Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.  Stores energy for use with spit up and swallow.  Up to three levels of energy can be stored, and all are lost if the user leaves the field.  Energy is still stored even if the stat boosts cannot be applied.

If the user uses baton pass, the stat boosts are passed as normal, but the stored energy is not.
254.short_effect: Stores energy up to three times for use with Spit Up and Swallow.
254.flavor_text:
Charges up power for up to
3 turns.

255.name: spit-up
255.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is equal to 100 times the amount of energy stored by stockpile.  Ignores the random factor in the damage formula.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user's Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
255.short_effect: Power is 100 times the amount of energy Stockpiled.
255.flavor_text:
Releases stockpiled power
(the more the better).

256.name: swallow
256.description: Heals the user depending on the amount of energy stored by stockpile: 1/4 its max HP after one use, 1/2 its max HP after two uses, or fully after three uses.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user's Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.
256.short_effect: Recovers 1/4 HP after one Stockpile, 1/2 HP after two Stockpiles, or full HP after three Stockpiles.
256.flavor_text:
Absorbs stockpiled power
and restores HP.

257.name: heat-wave
257.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
257.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
257.flavor_text:
Exhales a hot breath on the
foe. May inflict a burn.

258.name: hail
258.description:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with snow cloak are exempt from this effect's damage.
258.short_effect: Changes the weather to a hailstorm for five turns.
258.flavor_text:
Summons a hailstorm that
strikes every turn.

259.name: torment
259.description:
Prevents the target from attempting to use the same move twice in a row.  When the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If the target is forced to attempt a repeated move due to choice band, choice scarf, choice specs, disable, encore, taunt, only having PP remaining for one move, or any other effect, the target will use struggle instead.  The target is then free to use the forced move next turn, as it didn't use that move this turn.
259.short_effect: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.
259.flavor_text:
Torments the foe and stops
successive use of a move.

260.name: flatter
260.description: Raises the target's Special Attack by one stage, then confuses it.
260.short_effect: Raises the target's Special Attack by one stage and confuses the target.
260.flavor_text:
Confuses the foe, but
raises its SP. ATK.

261.name: will-o-wisp
261.flavor_text:
Inflicts a burn on the foe
with intense fire.

262.name: memento
262.description: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
262.short_effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
262.flavor_text:
The user faints and lowers
the foe’s abilities.

263.name: facade
263.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.
263.short_effect: Power doubles if user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.
263.flavor_text:
Boosts ATTACK when burned,
paralyzed, or poisoned.

264.name: focus-punch
264.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
264.short_effect: If the user takes damage before attacking, the attack is canceled.
264.flavor_text:
A powerful loyalty attack.
The user flinches if hit.

265.name: smelling-salts
265.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is paralyzed, this move has double power, and the target is cured of its paralysis.
265.short_effect: If the target is paralyzed, inflicts double damage and cures the paralysis.
265.flavor_text:
Powerful against paralyzed
foes, but also heals them.

266.name: follow-me
266.description:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
266.short_effect: Redirects the target's single-target effects to the user for this turn.

foes attack only the user.

267.name: nature-power

Terrain                   | Selected move

Mountain                  | rock slide

Tall grass                | seed bomb
electric terrain | thunderbolt

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Selected move
-------------- | ------------------
Courtyard      | tri attack
Crystal        | rock slide
Gateway        | hydro pump
Magma          | rock slide
Main Street    | tri attack
Neon           | tri attack
Stargazer      | rock slide
Sunny Park     | seed bomb
Sunset         | earthquake
Waterfall      | seed bomb

267.short_effect: Uses a move which depends upon the terrain.
267.flavor_text:
The type of attack varies
depending on the location.

268.name: charge
268.description: Raises the user's Special Defense by one stage.  If the user uses an electric move next turn, its power will be doubled.

268.flavor_text:

electric move used next.

269.name: taunt
269.description:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.
269.short_effect: For the next few turns, the target can only use damaging moves.
269.flavor_text:

using attack moves.

270.name: helping-hand
270.description:

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
270.short_effect: Ally's next move inflicts half more damage.
270.flavor_text:
A move that boosts
the power of the
ally’s attack in a
Double Battle.

271.name: trick
271.description:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice band, choice scarf, or choice specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
271.flavor_text:
Tricks the foe into trading
held items.

272.name: role-play
272.description:
User's ability is replaced with the target's until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance change, trace, wonder guard, or zen mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
272.flavor_text:
Mimics the target and

273.name: wish
273.description: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user's max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.
273.short_effect: User will recover half its max HP at the end of the next turn.
273.flavor_text:
A wish that restores HP.
It takes time to work.

274.name: assist
274.description:
Uses a move from another Pokémon in the user's party, both selected at random.  Moves from fainted Pokémon can be used.  If there are no eligible Pokémon or moves, this move will fail.

This move will not select assist, chatter, circle throw, copycat, counter, covet, destiny bond, detect, dig, dive, dragon tail, endure, feint, fly focus punch, follow me, helping hand, me first, metronome, mimic, mirror coat, mirror move, phantom force protect, quick guard, roar shadow force, sketch, sleep talk, snatch, struggle, switcheroo, thief, trick, whirlwind, or wide guard.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by metronome or sleep talk.
274.short_effect: Randomly selects and uses one of the trainer's other Pokémon's moves.
274.flavor_text:
Attacks randomly with one
of the partner’s moves.

275.name: ingrain
275.description:

roar and whirlwind will not affect the user.  The user cannot use magnet rise.

The user may still use u turn to leave the field.

This effect can be passed with baton pass.
275.short_effect: Prevents the user from leaving battle.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP every turn.
275.flavor_text:
Lays roots that restore HP.
The user can’t switch out.

276.name: superpower
276.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

276.flavor_text:

but lowers abilities.

277.name: magic-coat
277.description:

defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
277.short_effect: Reflects back the first effect move used on the user this turn.
277.flavor_text:
Reflects special effects
back to the attacker.

278.name: recycle
278.description:
User recovers the last item consumed by the user or a Pokémon in its position on the field.  The item must be used again before it can be recovered by this move again.  If the user is holding an item, this move fails.

Items taken or given away by covet, knock off, switcheroo, thief, or trick may not be recovered.
278.short_effect: User recovers the item it last used up.
278.flavor_text:
Recycles a used item for
one more use.

279.name: revenge
279.description:

pain split does not count as damaging the user.
279.short_effect: Inflicts double damage if the user takes damage before attacking this turn.
279.flavor_text:

280.flavor_text:

281.description:

281.short_effect: Target sleeps at the end of the next turn.
281.flavor_text:

282.flavor_text:

285.description:

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder guard, this move will fail.
285.flavor_text:

286.name: imprison
286.description: Prevents any Pokémon on the opposing side of the field from using any move the user knows until the user leaves the field.  This effect is live; if the user obtains new moves while on the field, these moves become restricted.  If no opposing Pokémon knows any of the user's moves when this move is used, this move will fail.

288.description: If the user faints before it next acts, the move that fainted it will have its PP dropped to 0.  End-of-turn damage does not trigger this effect.

289.name: snatch
289.description:
The next time a Pokémon uses a beneficial move on itself or itself and its ally this turn, the user of this move will steal the move and use it itself.  Moves which may be stolen by this move are identified by the "snatchable" flag.

If two Pokémon use this move on the same turn, the faster Pokémon will steal the first beneficial move, and the slower Pokémon will then steal it again—thus, only the slowest Pokémon using this move ultimately gains a stolen move's effect.

If the user steals psych up, it will target the Pokémon that used psych up.  If the user was the original target of psych up, and the Pokémon that originally used it's affected by pressure, it will only lose 1 PP.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

289.flavor_text:

306.name: crush-claw

306.short_effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
306.flavor_text:

claws. May lower DEFENSE.

Powerful, but leaves the
user immobile the next turn.

310.name: astonish

317.short_effect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
317.flavor_text:

318.name: silver-wind
318.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.
318.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats by one stage.
318.flavor_text:
A powdery attack that may
raise abilities.

319.name: metal-sound
319.description: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
319.short_effect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
319.flavor_text:
Emits a horrible screech

320.name: grass-whistle

321.name: tickle

321.short_effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage.
321.flavor_text:

lower ATTACK and DEFENSE.

322.name: cosmic-power

322.short_effect: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
322.flavor_text:

323.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the user's remaining HP and is given by `150 * HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 150 when the user has full HP.
323.short_effect: Inflicts more damage when the user has more HP remaining, with a maximum of 150 power.
323.flavor_text:
Inflicts more damage if the
user’s HP is high.

324.name: signal-beam
324.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.
324.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.
324.flavor_text:
A strange beam attack that
may confuse the foe.

325.name: shadow-punch
325.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
325.flavor_text:
An unavoidable punch that

326.name: extrasensory
326.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
326.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
326.flavor_text:
Attacks with a peculiar
power. May cause flinching.

327.name: sky-uppercut
327.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop.
327.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage and can hit Bounce and Fly users.
327.flavor_text:
An uppercut thrown as if
leaping into the sky.

328.name: sand-tomb
328.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.
328.short_effect: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.
328.flavor_text:

quicksand for 2 to 5 turns.

329.name: sheer-cold

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.
329.flavor_text:
A chilling attack that
causes fainting if it hits.

330.name: muddy-water
330.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
330.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
330.flavor_text:
Attacks with muddy water.
May lower accuracy.

331.name: bullet-seed
331.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
331.flavor_text:
Shoots 2 to 5 seeds in a row
to strike the foe.

332.name: aerial-ace

332.flavor_text:

unavoidable attack.

333.name: icicle-spear

333.flavor_text:

2 to 5 icicles in a row.

334.name: iron-defense

334.short_effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.
334.flavor_text:

335.short_effect: Prevents the target from leaving battle.
335.flavor_text:
Blocks the foe’s way to
prevent escape.

336.name: howl
336.description: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
336.short_effect: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
336.flavor_text:

337.name: dragon-claw
337.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
337.flavor_text:
Slashes the foe with sharp
claws.

338.name: frenzy-plant

338.short_effect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
338.flavor_text:

339.name: bulk-up

339.flavor_text:

340.name: bounce
340.description:

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
340.short_effect: User bounces high into the air, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.

Bounces up, then down the
next turn. May paralyze.

341.name: mud-shot
341.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
341.short_effect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
341.flavor_text:
Hurls mud at the foe and
reduces SPEED.

342.name: poison-tail
342.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a 10% chance to poison the target.
342.short_effect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit and a 10% chance to poison the target.
342.flavor_text:
Has a high critical-hit
ratio. May also poison.

343.name: covet
343.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
343.flavor_text:
Cutely begs to obtain an
item held by the foe.

344.name: volt-tackle
344.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
344.short_effect: User takes 1/3 the damage inflicted in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
344.flavor_text:
A life-risking tackle that
slightly hurts the user.

345.name: magical-leaf
345.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
345.flavor_text:
Attacks with a strange leaf
that cannot be evaded.

346.name: water-sport
346.description: fire moves inflict half damage, regardless of target.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
346.flavor_text:
The user becomes soaked to
raise resistance to fire.

347.name: calm-mind
347.description: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.
347.short_effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage.
347.flavor_text:
Raises SP. ATK and SP. DEF
by focusing the mind.

348.name: leaf-blade
348.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
348.short_effect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
348.flavor_text:
Slashes with a sharp leaf.
High critical-hit ratio.

349.name: dragon-dance
349.description: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage each.
349.short_effect: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage.
349.flavor_text:
A mystical dance that ups
ATTACK and SPEED.

350.name: rock-blast
350.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
350.flavor_text:
Hurls boulders at the foe
2 to 5 times in a row.

351.name: shock-wave
351.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
351.flavor_text:
A fast and unavoidable
electric attack.

352.name: water-pulse
352.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
352.short_effect: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
352.flavor_text:
Attacks with ultrasonic
waves. May confuse the foe

353.name: doom-desire
353.description:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
353.short_effect: Hits the target two turns later.
353.flavor_text:
Summons strong sunlight to
attack 2 turns later.

354.name: psycho-boost
354.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
354.short_effect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.
354.flavor_text:
Allows a full-power attack,
but sharply lowers SP. ATK.

355.name: roost
355.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.
355.short_effect: Heals the user by half its max HP.
355.flavor_text:
The user lands and
rests its body.
It restores the
user’s HP by up to
half of its max HP.

356.name: gravity
356.description:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena trap, spikes, or toxic spikes.

bounce, fly, sky drop, high jump kick, jump kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.
356.short_effect: Disables moves and immunities that involve flying or levitating for five turns.
356.flavor_text:
Gravity is intensified
for five turns, making
moves involving flying
unusable and
negating Levitation.

357.name: miracle-eye
357.description: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A dark Pokémon under this effect takes normal damage from psychic moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
357.short_effect: Forces the target to have no evasion, and allows it to be hit by Psychic moves even if it's Dark.
357.flavor_text:
Enables a Dark-type target to be hit by
Psychic-type attacks. This also enables
an evasive target to be hit.

358.name: wake-up-slap
358.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is sleeping, this move has double power, and the target wakes up.
358.short_effect: If the target is asleep, has double power and wakes it up.
358.flavor_text:
This attack inflicts
high damage on a
sleeping foe. It
also wakes the foe
up, however.

359.name: hammer-arm
359.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.
359.short_effect: Lowers user's Speed by one stage.
359.flavor_text:
The user swings and
hits with its strong
and heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s
Speed, however.

360.name: gyro-ball
360.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.
360.short_effect: Power raises when the user has lower Speed, up to a maximum of 150.
360.flavor_text:
The user tackles the
foe with a high-speed
spin. The slower the
user, the greater
the damage.

361.name: healing-wish
361.description: User faints.  Its replacement's HP is fully restored, and any major status effect is removed.  If the replacement Pokémon is immediately fainted by a switch-in effect, the next replacement is healed by this move instead.
361.short_effect: User faints.  Its replacement has its HP fully restored and any major status effect removed.
361.flavor_text:
The user faints. In
return, the Pokémon
taking its place will
have its HP restored
and status cured.

362.name: brine
362.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.
362.short_effect: Has double power against Pokémon that have less than half their max HP remaining.
362.flavor_text:
If the foe’s HP is
down to about half,
this attack will hit
with double the
power.

363.name: natural-gift
363.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.
363.short_effect: Power and type depend on the held berry.
363.flavor_text:
The user draws power
to attack by using
its held Berry.
The Berry determines
its type and power.

364.name: feint
364.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the effects of detect or protect from the target before hitting.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
364.flavor_text:
An attack that hits a
foe using Protect or
Detect. It also lifts
the effects of those
moves.

365.name: pluck
365.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.
365.short_effect: If target has a berry, inflicts double damage and uses the berry.
365.flavor_text:
The user pecks the
foe. If the foe is
holding a Berry, the
user plucks it and
gains its effect.

366.name: tailwind
366.description: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.
366.short_effect: For three turns, friendly Pokémon have doubled Speed.
366.flavor_text:
The user whips up a
turbulent whirlwind
that ups the Speed
of all party Pokémon
for three turns.

367.name: acupressure
367.description:
Raises one of the target's stats by two stages.  The raised stat is chosen at random from any stats that can be raised by two stages.  If no stat is eligible, this move will fail.

If the target has a substitute, this move will have no effect, even if the user is the target.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
367.short_effect: Raises one of a friendly Pokémon's stats at random by two stages.
367.flavor_text:
The user applies
pressure to stress
points, sharply
boosting one of its
stats.

368.name: metal-burst
368.description: Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a damaging move this turn.  Inflicts 1.5× the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.
368.short_effect: Strikes back at the last Pokémon to hit the user this turn with 1.5× the damage.
368.flavor_text:
The user retaliates
against the foe that
last inflicted damage
on it with much
greater power.

369.name: u-turn
369.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.
369.short_effect: User must switch out after attacking.
369.flavor_text:
After making its
attack, the user
rushes back to switch
places with a party
Pokémon in waiting.

370.name: close-combat
370.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
370.short_effect: Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage after inflicting damage.
370.flavor_text:
The user fights the
foe in close without
guarding itself. It
also cuts the user’s
Defense and Sp. Def.

371.name: payback
371.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.
371.short_effect: Power is doubled if the target has already moved this turn.
371.flavor_text:
If the user can use
this attack after the
foe attacks, its
power is doubled.

372.name: assurance
372.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.
372.short_effect: Power is doubled if the target has already received damage this turn.
372.flavor_text:
If the foe has
already taken some
damage in the same
turn, this attack’s
power is doubled.

373.name: embargo
373.description:
Target cannot use its held item for five turns.  If the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If a Pokémon under this effect uses bug bite or pluck on a Pokémon holding a berry, the berry is destroyed but not used.  If a Pokémon under this effect uses fling, it will fail.

This effect is passed by baton pass.
373.flavor_text:
It prevents the foe
from using its held
item. Its Trainer is
also prevented from
using items on it.

374.name: fling
374.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.
374.short_effect: Throws held item at the target; power depends on the item.
374.flavor_text:
The user flings its
held item at the foe
to attack. Its power
and effects depend
on the item.

375.name: psycho-shift
375.description: If the user has a major status effect and the target does not, the user's status is transferred to the target.
375.short_effect: Transfers the user's major status effect to the target.
375.flavor_text:
Using its psychic
power of suggestion,
the user transfers
its status problems
to the target.

376.name: trump-card
376.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is determined by the PP remaining for this move, after its PP cost is deducted.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

PP remaining | Power
------------ | ----:
4 or more    |    40
3            |    50
2            |    60
1            |    80
0            |   200

If this move is activated by another move, the activating move's PP is used to calculate power.
376.short_effect: Power increases when this move has less PP, up to a maximum of 200.
376.flavor_text:
The fewer PP this
move has, the more
power it has for
attack.

377.name: heal-block
377.description: For the next five turns, the target may not use any moves that only restore HP, and move effects that heal the target are disabled.  Moves that steal HP may still be used, but will only inflict damage and not heal the target.
377.short_effect: Prevents target from restoring its HP for five turns.
377.flavor_text:
The user prevents
the foe from using
any HP-recovery
moves for five turns.

378.name: wring-out
378.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power directly relates to the target's relative remaining HP, given by `1 + 120 * current HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 121.
378.short_effect: Power increases against targets with more HP remaining, up to a maximum of 121 power.
378.flavor_text:
The user powerfully
wrings the foe.
The more HP the foe
has, the greater this
attack’s power.

379.name: power-trick
379.description:
The user's original Attack and Defense are swapped.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
379.flavor_text: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack stat with its Defense stat.

380.name: gastro-acid
380.description:
The target's ability is disabled as long as it remains on the field.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
380.short_effect: Nullifies target's ability until it leaves battle.
380.flavor_text:
The user hurls up its
stomach acids on
the foe. The fluid
eliminates the effect
of the foe’s ability.

381.name: lucky-chant
381.description: For five turns, opposing Pokémon cannot score critical hits.
381.short_effect: Prevents the target from scoring critical hits for five turns.
381.flavor_text:
The user chants an
incantation toward
the sky, preventing
the foe from landing
critical hits.

382.name: me-first
382.description:
If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power.

If the target moves before the user, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
382.short_effect: Uses the target's move against it before it attacks, with power increased by half.
382.flavor_text:
The user tries to cut
ahead of the foe to
steal and use the
foe’s intended move
with greater power.

383.name: copycat
383.description:
Uses the last move that was used successfully by any Pokémon, including the user.

This move cannot copy itself, nor roar nor whirlwind.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
383.short_effect: Uses the target's last used move.
383.flavor_text:
The user mimics the
move used immediately
before it. The move
fails if no other move
has been used yet.

384.name: power-swap
384.description: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.
384.short_effect: User swaps Attack and Special Attack changes with the target.
384.flavor_text:
The user employs its
psychic power to
switch changes to
its Attack and
Sp. Atk with the foe.

385.name: guard-swap
385.description: User swaps its Defense and Special Defense modifiers with the target.
385.short_effect: User swaps Defense and Special Defense changes with the target.
385.flavor_text:
The user employs its
psychic power to
switch changes to
its Defense and
Sp. Def with the foe.

386.name: punishment
386.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power starts at 60 and is increased by 20 for every stage any of the target's stats has been raised, capping at 200.  Accuracy and evasion modifiers do not increase this move's power.
386.short_effect: Power increases against targets with more raised stats, up to a maximum of 200.
386.flavor_text:
This attack’s power
increases the more
the foe has powered
up with stat changes.

387.name: last-resort
387.description: Inflicts regular damage.  This move can only be used if each of the user's other moves has been used at least once since the user entered the field.  If this is the user's only move, this move will fail.
387.short_effect: Can only be used after all of the user's other moves have been used.
387.flavor_text:
This move can be used
only after the user
has used all the
other moves it knows
in the battle.

388.name: worry-seed
388.description:
Changes the target's ability to insomnia.

If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.
388.short_effect: Changes the target's ability to Insomnia.
388.flavor_text:
A seed that causes
worry is planted on
the foe. It prevents
sleep by making its
ability Insomnia.

389.name: sucker-punch
389.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has not selected a damaging move this turn, or if the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

This move is not affected by iron fist.
389.short_effect: Only works if the target is about to use a damaging move.
389.flavor_text:
This move enables the
user to attack first.
It fails if the foe is
not readying an
attack, however.

390.name: toxic-spikes
390.description:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton pass are not affected by this effect.
390.short_effect: Scatters poisoned spikes, poisoning opposing Pokémon that switch in.
390.flavor_text:
The user lays a trap
of poison spikes at
the foe’s feet. They
poison foes that
switch into battle.

391.name: heart-swap
391.description: User swaps its stat modifiers with the target.
391.short_effect: User and target swap stat changes.
391.flavor_text:
The user employs its
psychic power to
switch stat changes
with the foe.

392.name: aqua-ring
392.description:
Restores 1/16 of the user's max HP at the end of each turn.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
392.short_effect: Restores 1/16 of the user's max HP each turn.
392.flavor_text:
The user envelops
itself in a veil made
of water. It regains
some HP on every
turn.

393.name: magnet-rise
393.description:
For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves.

If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail.

This effect is temporarily disabled by and cannot be used during gravity.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
393.short_effect: User is immune to Ground moves and effects for five turns.
393.flavor_text:
The user levitates using electrically
generated magnetism for five turns.

394.name: flare-blitz
394.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.
394.short_effect: User takes 1/3 the damage inflicted in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
394.flavor_text:
The user cloaks
itself in fire and
charges at the foe.
The user sustains
serious damage, too.

395.name: force-palm
395.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
395.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
395.flavor_text:
The foe is attacked
with a shock wave.
It may also leave the
target paralyzed.

396.name: aura-sphere
396.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
396.flavor_text:
The user looses a
blast of aura power
from deep within its
body. This move is
certain to hit.

397.name: rock-polish
397.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.
397.short_effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.
397.flavor_text:
The user polishes its
body to reduce drag.
It can sharply raise
the Speed stat.

398.name: poison-jab
398.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.
398.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.
398.flavor_text:
The foe is stabbed
with a tentacle or
arm steeped in
poison. It may also
poison the foe.

399.name: dark-pulse
399.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
399.short_effect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
399.flavor_text:
The user releases a
horrible aura imbued
with dark thoughts.
It may also make the
target flinch.

400.name: night-slash
400.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
400.short_effect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
400.flavor_text:
The user slashes the
foe the instant an
opportunity arises.
It has a high
critical-hit ratio.

401.name: aqua-tail
401.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
401.flavor_text:
The user attacks by
swinging its tail as if
it were a vicious wave
in a raging storm.

402.name: seed-bomb
402.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
402.flavor_text:
The user slams a
barrage of hard-
shelled seeds
down on the foe
from above.

403.name: air-slash
403.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
403.short_effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
403.flavor_text:
The user attacks with
a blade of air that
slices even the sky.
It may also make the
target flinch.

404.name: x-scissor
404.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
404.flavor_text:
The user slashes at
the foe by crossing
its scythes or claws
as if they were a pair
of scissors.

405.name: bug-buzz
405.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
405.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
405.flavor_text:
The user vibrates its
wings to generate a
damaging sound wave.
It may also lower the
foe’s Sp. Def stat.

406.name: dragon-pulse
406.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
406.flavor_text:
The foe is attacked
with a shock wave
generated by the
user’s gaping mouth.

407.name: dragon-rush
407.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
407.short_effect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
407.flavor_text:
The user tackles the
foe while exhibiting
overwhelming menace.
It may also make the
target flinch.

408.name: power-gem
408.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
408.flavor_text:
The user attacks with
a ray of light that
sparkles as if it were
made of gemstones.

409.name: drain-punch
409.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
409.short_effect: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
409.flavor_text:
An energy-draining
punch. The user’s
HP is restored by
half the damage taken
by the target.

410.name: vacuum-wave
410.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
410.flavor_text:
The user whirls its
fists to send a wave
of pure vacuum at
the foe. This move
always goes first.

411.name: focus-blast
411.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
411.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
411.flavor_text:
The user heightens
its mental focus and
unleashes its power.
It may also lower the
target’s Sp. Def.

412.name: energy-ball
412.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
412.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
412.flavor_text:
The user draws power
from nature and
fires it at the foe.
It may also lower the
target’s Sp. Def.

413.name: brave-bird
413.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
413.short_effect: User receives 1/3 the damage inflicted in recoil.
413.flavor_text:
The user tucks in
its wings and charges
from a low altitude.
The user also takes
serious damage.

414.name: earth-power
414.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
414.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
414.flavor_text:
The user makes the
ground under the foe
erupt with power.
It may also lower the
target’s Sp. Def.

415.name: switcheroo
415.description:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice band, choice scarf, or choice specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
415.flavor_text:
The user trades held
items with the foe
faster than the eye
can follow.

416.name: giga-impact
416.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
416.short_effect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
416.flavor_text:
The user charges at
the foe using every
bit of its power.
The user must rest
on the next turn.

417.name: nasty-plot
417.description: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
417.short_effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
417.flavor_text:
The user stimulates
its brain by thinking
bad thoughts.
It sharply raises the
user’s Sp. Atk.

418.name: bullet-punch
418.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
418.flavor_text:
The user strikes
with a tough punch as
fast as a bullet.
This move always goes
first.

419.name: avalanche
419.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target damaged the user this turn and was the last to do so, this move has double power.

pain split does not count as damaging the user.
419.short_effect: Inflicts double damage if the user takes damage before attacking this turn.
419.flavor_text:
An attack move that
inflicts double the
damage if the user
has been hurt by the
foe in the same turn.

420.name: ice-shard
420.short_effect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
420.flavor_text:
The user flash
freezes chunks of
ice and hurls them.
This move always goes
first.

421.name: shadow-claw
421.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
421.short_effect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
421.flavor_text:
The user slashes with
a sharp claw made
from shadows.
It has a high
critical-hit ratio.

422.name: thunder-fang
422.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.
422.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
422.flavor_text:
The user bites with
electrified fangs.
It may also make the
foe flinch or become
paralyzed.

423.name: ice-fang
423.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.
423.short_effect: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
423.flavor_text:
The user bites with
cold-infused fangs.
It may also make the
foe flinch or freeze.

424.name: fire-fang
